question: For the FY 2019-20, which sea food was the largest product to be exported from India?
explanation:
Frozen shrimp was the major export product among the sea food followed by frozen fish in FY 2010-20. India has shipped 12.89 lakh tones of seafood during the last financial year amounting USD 6.68 billion.
The USA and China were the largest importers of Indian seafood. The Marine Products Export Development Authority (MPEDA) is aiming to increase the countryâ€™s sea food exports to Rs 1 trillion by 2030.
